verse:
श्रीमद्भ‍ागवतं पुराणममलं यद्वैष्णवानां प्रियं यस्मिन् पारमहंस्यमेकममलं ज्ञानं परं गीयते ।
तत्र ज्ञानविरागभक्तिसहितं नैष्कर्म्यमाविष्कृतं तच्छृण्वन्सुपठन्विचारणपरो भक्त्या विमुच्येन्नरः ॥

terms.jñāna-virāga-bhakti-sahitam: together with knowledge, renunciation and devotion

vedabase.translation: Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam is the spotless Purāṇa. It is most dear to the Vaiṣṇavas because it describes the pure and supreme knowledge of the paramahaṁsas. This Bhāgavatam reveals the means for becoming free from all material work, together with the processes of transcendental knowledge, renunciation and devotion. Anyone who seriously tries to understand Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam, who properly hears and chants it with devotion, becomes completely liberated.
vedabase.purport: Because Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam is completely free of contamination by the modes of nature, it is endowed with extraordinary spiritual beauty and is therefore dear to the pure devotees of the Lord. The word pāramahaṁsyam indicates that even completely liberated souls are eager to hear and narrate Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam. Those who are trying to be liberated should faithfully serve this literature by hearing and reciting it with faith and devotion.

terms.अमलं यत् वैष्णवानां प्रियं: which is pure and beloved to the Vaishnavas,
terms.यस्मिन् पारमहंस्यम् एकम् अमलं ज्ञानं परं: in which the supreme knowledge of the pure and incarnate divine is sung,
terms.तत्र ज्ञानविरागभक्तिसहितं नैष्कर्म्यम् आ: therein, knowledge, detachment, and devotion are revealed along with the path of selfless action,
terms.तद् शृण्वन् सुपठन् विचारणपरः भक्त्या विम: a person who hears, chants, and contemplates on this with devotion, becomes liberated.

bard.meaning: Overall meaning:Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam Purāṇa is pure and dear to devotees of Viṣṇu. In it, supreme knowledge, one knowledge is sung. There, knowledge, renunciation and devotion are completely pervaded without fruitive activity. Hearing it repeatedly, contemplating deeply with devotion, man is liberated.
